newsitem.title: JAPAN: Dollar seen firmer but top-heavy in Asia.
newsitem.headline: Dollar seen firmer but top-heavy in Asia.

text.p: The dollar is expected to edge up against the yen on short-covering during Asian trading time on Tuesday after tumbling more than two yen on Monday, dealers said.
But its topside remains heavy near 113.50 yen on possible sales by exporters and Japanese investors, they added.

Another downside test below 112 yen is seen unlikely following comments by Japanese and U.S. officials on currencies on Monday, including remarks by U.S. Treasury Secretary Robert Rubin, who reiterated that the United States favours a strong dollar, dealers said.
